639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:12): my questions are...

639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:13): and wonder if the pentium 3 coppermine 1000mhz fsb133 run on the same board like in the ibm thinkpad t20 which has a 700mhz pentium 3 mobile
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:13): and maybe even use the same ram ...
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:14): this laptop here is really unreliable
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:14): it seems to just work with one ram module inserted etc.
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:14): and it's stupid plastic cheap stuff
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:14): and i could get a thinkpad t20 really cheap, and then would just use the useful hardware from this laptop
639f6679b24f51ec1d8e8cd59831cc13 (20:17): i tested one of a friend
e8d22bafb181c7f799b65e3e1a8a549f (20:19): 256 Micron PC100 144 pin CL2 SODIMM 16X16

e8d22bafb181c7f799b65e3e1a8a549f (20:19): a lot of memory upgrade problems on google
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:20): I need to get myself some nice used thinkpad from ebay.de

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:32): is anyone here that can help me?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:32): need desperate help if possible
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:34): what's up this time?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:35): need to get as hard drive fixed ok
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:35): my 40 gig drive has a read error on it and wont let my pc boot with it hoooked up

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:36): what is always fun

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:36): got a linux livecd?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:37): no i dont im running xp professional
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:37): off the 4 gig hd?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:37): yes off the 4 gig drive - only working drive ive got

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:38): although if you get read errors... depends on the read errors...

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:40): when i hook up 40 gig hd to connector pc wont boot
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:40): so do you get a bsod with the 40 gig one?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:40): no i dont get bsod with 40 gig one
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:40): won't post or windows won't boot?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:40): i just get read error
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:40): press ctrl alt del to reboot

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:41): or a bios error?

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:41): pc does with 40 gig hd hooked up

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:42): download one and burn it

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:44): well, I don't think windows has any good diagnosis tools

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:44): i do have a knoppix linux cd somewhere
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:45): yes, that is all that I can suggest
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:45): windows probably has some fancy schmancy propertairy expensive GUI disk recovery wizards
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:45): although it might be better to first find out if the drive is totally cacked or not
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:46): windows error messages are hardly very specific
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:46): don't tell you if the drive is kaput, the filesystem is or whatever
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:49): but what can i do since i dont have a bootable linux cd

bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:52): perhaps something like that

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:53): Press ctrl alt del to reboot

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:54): right when i turn on the pc

66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:57): yes i saw stuff for my maxtor 40 gig hd but nothing for diagnostics for maxtor just install software
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:57): is your 40 gig hard drive a maxtor?
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (20:58): it cant bundled with my pc
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:58): http://maxtor.com/portal/site/Maxtor/menuitem.3c67e325e0a6b1f6294198b091346068/?channelpath=/en_us/Support/Software%20Downloads/Top%20Downloads&downloadID=22
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:59): you need a floppy drive though
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:59): "he PowerMax utility is effective on all ATA (IDE) hard drives with a capacity greater than or equal to 500 MB."
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (20:59): oh right, 500 MB, not GB
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (21:00): will it do diagnostics
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (21:00): and ive got a floppy disk drive
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:01): read the page...
66c3a7272f35c44c7d56f75e6177cb90 (21:01): got it downloading
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:01): "The PowerMax utility is designed to perform diagnostic read/write verifications on Maxtor and Quantum hard drives."
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:02): although if it's your BIOS that's giving you that error when you have the drive in then that's not going to help you much
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:02): but worth a try
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:02): if it's the BIOS that's giving the error (i.e. it shows up if you try and boot the floppy) then it's a goner
bab5d1733bee9596ea76260696246f5e (21:03): well, either your bios or windows is giving that error
